fields.title: Georges Bank Yellowtail Flounder, Eastern Georges Bank Cod and Haddock
fields.issue: As per the approved Terms of Reference for the 2021 TRAC meeting, Provide Advice for Eastern Georges Bank (EGB) Cod, EGB Haddock, and Georges Bank Yellowtail Flounder.
fields.consequence_text: Not possible at this time to speculate. However, impacts to Canada-US Relationship, fisheries management decisions made without Science Advice on crucial stocks in Maritimes Region. Sustainability of the Resource in question.
fields.assistance_text: Michelle Greenlaw, Irene Andrushchenko, Monica Finlay, Tara McIntyre .
fields.rationale: Ongoing annual advice as per the Canada/US Understanding. Info will be used for pre-TMGC consultations, TMGC negotiations as well as consultations with GOMAC, and allow time for the Minister to consider the TAC prior to a January 1, 2022 fishery opening.
fields.rationale_for_timing: Required for Transboundary Resource Assessment Committee (TRAC)process as per the agreement with the US. Ongoing annual advice as per the Canada/US Understanding. Info will be used for pre-TMGC consultations, TMGC negotiations as well as consultations with GOMAC, and allow time for the Minister to consider the TAC prior to a January 1, 2022 fishery opening.
fields.fiscal_year_text: TRAC is schedule July 12-14, 2021. Haddock is to be based on Canadian Participation in the US Research Track process for Georges Bank Haddock.
